Rules

Spoiler: Rules
(References: Equinox, Hoopla, Tierce, Vel-Rahn Koon, zoraster)

General

  1. Be familiar with the site-wide rules and guidelines.
  2. Please keep the game civil and avoid personal attacks. Use of homophobic, racist, sexist, or any other derogatory slurs will not be tolerated.
  3. While this game is running, you may not discuss this game anywhere outside of the game thread unless you have been explicitly allowed to do so.
  4. Do not quote any private communication, including game-related PMs, instant messages, and QuickTopics. Quoting time stamps from any private communication is also forbidden. Paraphrasing is allowed.
  5. If it is not visible to the naked eye, do not post it. This includes but is not limited to: invisible text, tiny text and encrypted text. 'Spoiler=' tags are fine. For cases of breadcrumbing where you aren't sure, please PM me beforehand.
  6. Do not edit or delete your posts.
  7. Do not use #8040FF. All other formatting is fair game.
  8. For minor questions or vote count errors, please bold your concern in the thread. For all other issues, PM me.
  9. Pretending to break the rules or exploiting loopholes in the rules will be considered breaking the rules.
  10. Flavor is for entertainment purposes only and has no significance in the game.

Activity

  1. Prods will be issued to players if they have not posted within a 48-hour period. Players who have been prodded have 24 hours to respond in the game thread before a replacement is sought.
  2. A post with the sole purpose of avoiding a prod (a 'prod dodge') will grant players a further 24 hours to post something game-related.
  3. For purposes of activity, Saturday and Sunday will be considered a 24-hour period.
  4. Players who have been prodded 3 times are subject to replacement without further notice.
  5. Players may request that a reminder be sent to a player who has not posted within 36 hours.
  6. If you anticipate being away for at least 48 hours, please PM me or post a V/LA notice in the thread with the expected date of your return.

Days and Nights

  1. Days will have a deadline of two weeks, and Nights will last 72 hours. Deadline extensions will be granted only in extreme circumstances.
  2. Lynches occur through simple majority (50% of living players + 1, rounded down). If no majority is reached at deadline or there is a majority of votes for No Lynch, Day will end without a lynch. Once majority is reached, no further votes or unvotes will count.
  3. Votes and vote revocations must be bolded (e.g., Vote: serrapaladin and Unvote). Unvotes are preferred but not necessary when switching votes (e.g., Unvote, Vote: No Lynch). Use of the vote tags (e.g., VOTE: serrapaladin) is optional.
  4. All players, including the lynched player, are allowed to talk in twilight phase until the thread is locked, at which point Day ends. Dead players may not post until the game has been officially declared over.
  5. The lynched player's alignment and role will be revealed once a majority has been achieved. The alignment and role of any players killed during the night are revealed the following morning.
  6. Actions not received by deadline will be considered forfeit. Actions may be submitted ahead of time and can be changed as many times as desired; at deadline, the last valid action that was submitted will be used. Actions may be submitted via PM or QuickTopic.
  7. Any situation not covered above will be handled on a case-by-case basis. I reserve the right to add, modify, or remove rules as necessary. I will notify you of any changes in the thread.


tl;dr Rules

  1. Lynches are by majority.
  2. Days are two weeks and Nights are 72 hours.
  3. This (#8040FF) is my color.
  4. 48 hours inactivity gets you a prod. Three prods are a replace. A prod dodge buys you 24 hours.
  5. PM me or post in bold for clarification.
  6. Have fun, be civil, and play to win!

For those of you thinking there's no point in vetting a real claim [even if it isn't a super awesome PR], let me provide a couple of scenarios to explore.

Let's say Nacho is lying. MS [or his soon to be replacement?] comes in and says, "Nacho is not my neighbor." Here's what goes down:
- We lynch Nacho. Nacho flips scum. Let's keep rolling.
- We lynch Nacho. Nacho flips neighbor. MS's slot is scum. We lynch MS tomorrow. Let's keep rolling.
- Least likely scenario? We lynch Nacho. Nacho flips VT or some stupid thing. We are out a Town liability. We shrug and soldier on without that kind of play holding us back.

If MS [or his soon to be replacement] says, "Nacho is my neighbor?" That makes a big difference and it's on to plan B. While the MS slot can't guarantee the alignment of Nacho [or themselves], it CAN provide information that there is no reason for us not to know and can give us a better understanding of the mechanics at play in this game. In this case, more information is better for the Town than for scum.

Mod's thoughts:

Setup

The setup was 1 Interrogator, 2 Masons, 1 T/T Neighbourhood, 1 T/S Neighbourhood, 4 VT's and 2 Goons.

The 2 Masons and the interrogator (which functioned much like a Doctor) were the majority of town power. I think you guys underestimate the power of masons. They're two confirmed townies right off the bat. A cop first needs to get his investigations in, and survive for long enough to claim them. When balancing, I count a pair of masons as about the equivalent of a 2/3-shot cop. The fact that all three scum still managed to avoid getting lynched is a testament to their good play.

The core setup was more or less 2 Masons & Doc vs. 3 Goons, which is at worst a little bit scum-sided (see for example the approved 13p open Friends and Enemies, with 3 masons vs. 3 goons - this is slightly scum-sided, but exchanging a goon for a doc and making it closed should more or less cancel that out).

The factor that I was hoping would help tilt the game towards town was the three separate neighbourhoods that existed every night. Town neighbours might not be particularly strong PR's, but the idea is of course that by discussing the game at night, Town Neighbours might be able to figure out the alignment of their neighbour. Unfortunately, much of this was negated by the early lynch of neighbours, and the fact that Ree exclusively targeted neighbours and Masons (of course through no fault of his own - I had fully intended that he use it to protect masons once they claimed. Had I bothered with more flavour this game, I would have likely gone for some sort of witness-protection description). Since there were 2 neighbourhoods and a masonry, I thought it likely you would decide that there's 1 scum among the neighbours, which splits the town into two, with 1/4 scum in the neighbours, and 2/9 scum in the rest.

As it happened, a lot in this game went badly for town, so the result may have been a bit scumsided, but I don't think there's much I would change about the setup. I considered adding a 5th VT to bring it up to 14 players, but that's no longer a mini.

One thing I didn't anticipate which I'm afraid adversely affected the game was the naming of the interrogator role. I didn't realise Interrogator is exclusively the name for a slightly altered scum version of Ree's role on EM, so I apologise for any confusion caused by that.


Modding

For the most part, I was able to stay on top of vote counts, deadlines, QT's and night actions. Thank you to ETL and others for stepping up with (unofficial) votecounts when I was away. One thing I take responsibility for is having to find another replacement for Infinity's slot. When he replaced in, he was the only offer I had, although he warned me he would have to replace back out. I was afraid I might not get back for at least another day, so I decided to replace him in the for the time being.

If I'm going to run another game with many QT's I should make the rule about QT-quoting more explicit. As it was, I think I'm happy with the decision of leaving Yates' slot intact, given that his QT quoting didn't give a game-altering advantage over just paraphrasing it.

Another thing I should have anticipated was how to explain Ree's role. Given that this was a normal game, I felt I should answer all questions about his role, but quoting his role PM upon request by shos was perhaps not the best way I could have handled it. From now on, in games with full flips I will post role PM's with all flips, and I'll withhold all role-information except role name and alignment in themed games.


Play

Night Actions

Night 1:
Ree interrogates Yates (success)
fuzzy kills stubbs (success)

Night 2:
Ree interrogates Rach (success)
Nachopappa kills Rach (failure)

Night 3:
Ree interrogates shos (success)
DoctorPepper kills Rach (success)

Night 4:
Ree interrogates shos (success)
fuzzy kills shos (failure)

Night 5:
Ree interrogates shos (success)
Nachopappa kills Ree (success)


As much as there were things here and there that made the game more difficult for town than it perhaps should have been, that shouldn't detract from the praise that Bert, DP, and fuzzy deserve for a flawless win. There were times when I was sure DP and fuzzy would have been lynched, but somehow they avoided it.

On the town side, Ree's gambit and claim were definitely a high point. Yates' counter-gambit was well-reasoned, and would have certainly been good play by him had I followed EM naming convention. As it was, his lynch was rather unfortunate and undeserved. A few of you had pretty good reads early on. I think stubbs basically nailed the scumteam D1, but he was of course killed N1. KA showed a good line of thought upon replacing in, and shos and Ree somewhat managed to keep the town together towards the end. Town wasn't falling to pieces as it often does after a few mislynches, scum just played well enough to avoid getting scumread.

Congrats again to Bert, DP, and fuzzy!

When things settle down a bit I plan on putting together a mini theme game and sending it in to be reviewed.

It will be a fantasy D and D style game kinda based on Neverwinter Nights 2

I posted my neighborhood/personal QT already, and since Metal Sonic was lynched D1 then all they had was pregame talk which probably wasn't too important. That is unless Nacho did a me and turned his neighborhood QT into a personal one.

My theories on balance is mostly coming from the fact that my only other closed normal was 10:2, with a doctor and nurse against a one-shot tracker and day-talk enabler. Despite there only being two scum instead of three, the mod actually said he thought it was scumsided postgame. I don't know if I said this yet, but one of the main reasons I referred to JK9 was because PR's in an open game pretty much double as IC's, so it's still two initial clears+investigative role. And personally I think that closed setups are always a fair amount more scumsided than open ones due to the amount of paranoia they create. Looking at Friends and Enemies, I think that the third mason would actually be more powerful than the doctor because it's losing a free clear for a chance of giving the town one more mislynch if and only if the doctor makes two successful protects over the course of the game, which the chances of are minimal. The only reason it made as much of a splash as it did here was because of Ree's bulletproof claim. That plus the fact that it was closed makes me think that it was more scumsided than anything. I should have realized though that a cop would push it way too far over the line of being townsided though.

Then again, I'm just the noob here who's only played two of these before, so I probably shouldn't talk about balancing at all. That's why I decided to mod an open instead of a closed, because as much as I scrutinize, I could never do it myself. (I'm third in the queue right now by the way, if you're interested in joining.)

Anyway, good games all around, and sorry I ended up causing more harm than good.
